Summary As part of an IT rotation leadership program, I solve business problems using technical solutions.  
My projects range from providing internal customers with analytics tools, to reporting on external revenue streams, in addition to providing reports for accounts payable for suppliers.  
I have received numerous recognition awards for my work within IT, and I'm always looking for alternative methods to contribute to Intel with my work, and volunteering efforts.  
 
I lead the Arizona chapter of IT community events, specifically for recent college graduates and new interns to promote networking usually through lunches, happy hours, and workshops among other various entertainment activities. 
I have been involved in recruiting efforts with UCLA, as well as mentoring new analysts onto my team. 
 
In the past, I worked as a web analytics and e-commerce analyst for U-Haul International focusing on creating trending web traffic reports for key department heads, driving web design change and campaigns for improved web experience. Additionally as a graphic designer for ASUonline, I created custom graphics and design specifications for online courses as well as provide quality assurance for media, both video and image, for inclusion in online educational materials. 
 
I graduated from the W.P. Carey School of Business in Computer Information Systems from ASU in 2013. 
 
My professional goals are to continue my work as a Systems Analyst, improving my skills with SQL, Excel, VBA, and other database and reporting tools. I also want to further my efforts to be involved with Intel's community through event facilitation, and volunteer efforts in my community. Summary A senior level director, manager, technical and information systems management consultant for large private and worldwide Fortune 500 corporations with over 35 years of experience. Highly skilled in all phases of custom design, analysis, development, technical architecture, systems integration, operations management, project management and best practices. I'm experienced in the implementation of enterprise production, inventory, distribution, sales, planning, forecasting, transportation and accounting systems and packages for government, retail, educational and corporate institutions, including the food, utilities, electronics, entertainment, textile, telecommunications and internet industries. 
 
I have also consulted in the refinement of corporate-wide development methodologies for improved service delivery, quality and productivity. As a highly regarded consultant for senior management, I have conducted situation and needs assessments to improve corporate process and operating costs. 
 
Technology background includes web development, client/server development, systems analysis and architecture, and project management with demonstrated effective leadership and team-building skills, along with excellent communication skills and a record of consistently completing projects on or ahead of schedule.  
 
I'm also president of the North American UNIFACE User Group (NAUUG), vice-president of the Oldsmobile Club of America, and president and founder of the Eastland Memorial Society (http://www.eastlandmemorial.org).
